newsitem.title: INDONESIA: Asahimas sees higher exports in 1997.
newsitem.headline: Asahimas sees higher exports in 1997.

text.p: Indonesian glass maker Asahimas Flat Glass Co. Ltd said on Tuesday it expected its export sales to grow to 34.0 percent of its total net sales for 1997, compared to 28.5 percent in 1996.
The company said in a statement the increase in exports was due to higher expected sales of high-quality and specialty glass as well as fabricated glass.
"In addition, Asahimas will start to export a new generation of mirrors in August 1997," the firm said.

The company also said that local demand showed healthy signs of recovery as the Indonesia Automobile Manufacturers Association (Gaikindo) had forecast car sales to grow by 27 percent in 1997 compared to 1996.
Asahimas makes a wide range of flat and fabricated glass for automobiles and the construction industry.
The company did not give further details.
